On the Notion of Digital Twins: A Modeling Perspective
DT Definition:
"A digital twin is a digital replica of a real object that replicates the behavior and states

purpose of MDE application:
"the formalized application of modeling to support system requirements, design, analysis, verification, and validation activities, beginning in the conceptual design phase and continuing through the development and later lifecycle phases [8].", " An executable
model is a precise model that a machine can interpret to automatically generate the desired
physical object without the active intervention of a human engineer"
purpose of DT: "The digital twin is the next stage in the evolution of product development, and in addition to a rich representation of the physical object, it also keeps the connection with the physical object.", "The digital twin can have different purposes, including, monitoring, control, optimization, and autonomy."
purpose /expected benefit of using model:
"Modeling is a
ubiquitous activity that is essential for all engineering and science disciplines. A model
can be defined as an abstract representation of reality, often a physical object."

system's behavior."

Title: Digital Twins for Sustainable Software Systems
Reason:
Philosophical, Opinion, or Experience paper (ehem. Challenges Paper) "a digital twin of a system consists
of a set of models of the system and a set of digital shadows,
both of which are purposefully updated on a regular basis,
and provides a set of services to use both purposefully with
respect to the original system. The digital twin interacts with
the original system by providing useful information about the
systems context and sending it control commands."
purpose of DT:
"The main functionalities
DTs provide for sustainability assessment are to monitor, calculate, and visualize sustainability indicators, and simulate and
forecast these indicators based on historic information."

Title: Concept of a Modular and System Model Driven Digital Twin for Engineering Education
DT Definition:
"It is generally defined as a concept in which operational data 
from a physical counterpart is processed within models to give 
recommendations towards a user or the system itself. Other 
components include its bidirectional orientation [9] as well as its 
real time capabilities [15]."
purpose of MDE application:
"MBSE seems a promising approach to grasp the increasing complexity of modern systems", "Hence, a model driven concept, 
which directly utilizes these models seems to be a promising 
approach e.g., by directly deriving executable code for the Twin. "
purpose of DT:
"Digital Twins must be utilized to solve problems 
and generate benefits."
purpose /expected benefit of using model:
"System models can help to 
visualize this complexity and at the same time being utilized to 
define this behaviour in a machine-readable context, such as 
shown in [26]. "
Use Case: system model driven Digital Twin in academia

Title: Supporting the Implementation of Digital Twins for IoT-Enhanced BPs
DT Definition:
"A Digital Twin (DT) is a virtual representation of real-world entities (physical objects
and systems, or immaterial things that exist over a significant time span) and processes
(events or activities that occur in time), synchronised at a specified frequency and fidelity
[1]. It connects with the physical part allowing data transfer from the physical to the
digital part and vice versa, in such a way that it can represent, simulate, or predict changes in the physical system."
purpose of MDE application:
"we propose a Model-Driven approach to support the creation
of the software artefacts required to represent, store and synchronise at runtime the
characteristics of real-world entities in IoT-enhanced BPs DTs."
purpose of DT:
"This work considers two main features of a digital twin system: (1)
the representation and storage of the characteristics of real-world entities in a structured
form, and (2) the runtime synchronisation between digital and real-world entities."
use case domain: M  Professional, Scientific and Technical Activities
Use Case: "management of CO2 levels in a library"

Title: Supporting the Implementation of Digital Twins for IoT-Enhanced BPs
